Donald Rumsfeld , who served as President Bush 's defense chief for six years after holding the the same job under president Gerald Ford in the 1970s, acknowledged that in a war, many things cost lives. the powerful Lakers. Michael Jordan late flurry silenced the Staples Center and unceremoniously ended Los Angeles' run at a perfect postseason.`` Anybody that bet on it, some broke people out there,'' Allen Iverson said. I'm glad nobody didn't bet their life on it'cause they definitely would be dead right now. Instead, the Sixers-- double-digit underdogs-- are very much alive as they again displayed their heroic heart.`` Our guys just try hard,'' Sixers coach Larry Bird David West said.`` This is kind of unexpected

way I wanted... I was a little upset, basically, because... we lost.'' Speaking at the Pro Bowl, Reggie Wayne told reporters that seeing Peyton Manning throw 11 interceptions during a three-game losing streak was a shock. The main thing we realized, he's not immortal. He's real. He's not a machine. It goes to show you this game is so competitive, even the guys on top can hit a wall somewhere. In Philadelphia, Michael Vick not only hit the wall, he spent a couple of years behind them in a prison cell.
